name: Tokyo 23 Wards - Sewer Design
description: Features the classic Tokyo metropolitan sewer design with cherry blossoms and the city crest, representing the capital's sewage system.

name: Rainbow Sewer Museum
description: Depicts the colorful rainbow motif associated with the Niji no Gesuidoukan (Rainbow Sewer Museum) in the Ariake waterfront area.

name: Ueno Park Design
description: Features a design inspired by the cultural and natural heritage of the Ueno Park area, a hub of museums and cherry blossoms.
distributionLocation: Tokyo Tourist Information Center Keisei Ueno

name: Tora-san Shibamata
description: Features the beloved film character Tora-san from 'Otoko wa Tsurai yo', set in the nostalgic Shibamata district of Katsushika.

name: Shinagawa Traditional Design
description: Showcases motifs representing Shinagawa's heritage as a historic post station along the old Tokaido highway.

name: Chiyoda Cherry Blossom
description: Celebrates Chiyoda ward's famous cherry blossom viewing spots around the Imperial Palace moat and Kitanomaru Park.

name: Setagaya Cat Design
description: Features a playful cat-themed design unique to Setagaya, one of Tokyo's largest residential wards known for its creative culture.

name: Shibuya Hachiko Design
description: Features design elements associated with Shibuya ward, distributed from the Sendagaya Social Education Center.

name: Suginami Animation Design
description: Reflects Suginami's identity as an animation hub, home to many famous anime studios and the Suginami Animation Museum.

name: Toshima Manga Art
description: Celebrates Toshima ward's status as an international art and culture city, featuring manga and anime inspired artwork near Ikebukuro.

name: Kita Ward Shibusawa Design
description: Features design elements related to Kita ward's connection to Eiichi Shibusawa, the father of Japanese capitalism, near Asukayama Park.

name: Adachi Fireworks Festival
description: Depicts the spectacular Adachi Fireworks Festival, one of Tokyo's earliest and most popular summer fireworks displays along the Arakawa River.

name: Shinagawa Musashi-Koyama Design
description: Features design motifs from the vibrant Musashi-Koyama shopping street area, one of Tokyo's longest covered shopping arcades.

name: Katsushika Captain Tsubasa
description: Features Captain Tsubasa, the iconic soccer manga character, celebrating Katsushika's connection to manga artist Yoichi Takahashi.

name: Shinjuku Godzilla Design
description: Celebrates Shinjuku's pop culture identity, distributed near the famous Kabukicho entertainment district and its Godzilla landmark.

name: Taito Asakusa Design
description: Features design elements from Taito ward's cultural heart, near the historic Asakusa and Senso-ji temple area.

name: Nerima Anime Heritage
description: Celebrates Nerima as the birthplace of Japanese anime, with design motifs honoring the ward's rich animation history.

name: Minato Ward Tower Design
description: Features iconic landmarks of Minato ward including Tokyo Tower and the modern waterfront development of the area.

name: Sumida Hokusai Wave
description: Features Katsushika Hokusai's 'The Great Wave off Kanagawa', honoring the legendary ukiyo-e artist who was born in Sumida ward.

name: Itabashi Historical Design
description: Reflects Itabashi's history as the first post station on the Nakasendo highway, connecting Edo to Kyoto.

name: Nakano Broadway Design
description: Celebrates Nakano Broadway, the iconic otaku shopping complex famous for vintage toys, manga, and anime collectibles.

name: Bunkyo Koishikawa Garden
description: Features the scenic Koishikawa Korakuen Garden, one of Tokyo's oldest and most beautiful Edo-period landscape gardens.

name: Meguro River Cherry Blossoms
description: Depicts the famous Meguro River lined with over 800 cherry blossom trees, one of Tokyo's most popular hanami spots.

name: Ota Haneda Airport Design
description: Features motifs inspired by Haneda Airport and the industrial waterfront heritage of Ota ward.

name: Chuo Nihonbashi Design
description: Celebrates the historic Nihonbashi Bridge, the traditional center of Tokyo and starting point of Japan's five major highways.

name: Edogawa Kasai Seaside
description: Features the seaside park and aquarium area of Kasai in Edogawa ward, a popular recreational destination on Tokyo Bay.

name: Arakawa Toden Streetcar
description: Depicts the beloved Tokyo Sakura Tram (Toden Arakawa Line), one of the last remaining streetcar lines in Tokyo.

name: Koto Fukagawa Festival
description: Celebrates the Fukagawa Hachiman Festival, one of Tokyo's three great festivals held every three years in the Monzen-nakacho area.

name: Shibuya Yoyogi Park Design
description: Features the expansive Yoyogi Park, a green oasis in central Tokyo known for its weekend flea markets and cultural events.

name: Toshima Sugamo Design
description: Features the charming Sugamo Jizo-dori shopping street, known as 'Grandma's Harajuku' for its popularity with elderly shoppers.
